intro: Psychotria aurantiaca var. lutescens, commonly known as the yellow psychotria, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its striking yellow flowers, which contrast with its dark green foliage. It typically grows as an erect shrub, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters. The leaves are usually ovate or elliptic in shape and have a smooth surface.
